episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the traditional attire of indigenous Bolivian women, the unique zoo in Kalamazoo, gravestones with recipes, and historical surgical practices. The hosts delve into these facts with humor and curiosity, exploring cultural, historical, and scientific angles.

facts.fact: Indigenous Bolivian women traditionally wear huge, colorful skirts and bowler hats.
There are no animals in the only zoo in Kalamazoo.
Doctors used to prepare their patients for surgery by either getting them really drunk or smacking them on the head with a mallet and hoping they didn't kill them.
